JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. 
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
Digital acquisition is one of American Express’ key priorities, and a core component of this is making the application process as easy and seamless as possible for potential applicants. The purpose of the US Commercial Application team is to grow billed business acquired and new accounts by accelerating the completed applications for our prospect and customer journeys and delivering new features to drive approval and engagement.
In this role, the analyst will support development by assisting in providing requirements for new features, be responsible for providing post launch insightful analysis in addition to ad-hoc reporting to identify optimization opportunities and conduct competitive analysis to analyze processes and application trends.  The analyst will partner closely with cross functional teams to ensure efficient prioritization and delivery of the product backlog.
Job Responsibilities:

Provide support for and/or lead core development projects within the US Commercial Application
Support requirement gathering and the creation of agile user stories and acceptance criteria
Support scrum team planning and story prioritization of the product backlog on a daily basis
Lead critical postlaunch analysis for the team’s core product releases, testing, and ongoing product performance and optimization
Partner closely with engineering and design to continuously optimize the UI/UX of application experiences
Partner closely with marketing stakeholders to understand the business needs and provide ongoing updates on key work in progress

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree 
Digital product development experience
Highly organized, detail oriented with a proven ability to manage multiple work flows 
Strong written and verbal communication skills 
Ability to work with and analyze large amounts of data, extracting key themes and messages to drive decisions
Able to effectively adapt under changing conditions and prioritize initiatives in a fastpaced environment 
Strong relationship management and problemsolving skills
Understanding of Agile principles an experience working in Scrum

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
